abstract.p: Data gathered by AdRelevance suggest that Internet music sites have benefited from increased ad revenue in wake of publicity surrounding Napster case (S)

block.p: In what may be seen as a silver lining to the legal clouds hovering over Internet music sites, data gathered by the advertising measurement service AdRelevance suggests that the sites have benefited from increased ad revenue in the wake of publicity surrounding this sector. During the two weeks after the July 26 injunction against the music file-sharing service Napster, advertising revenue at about 23 music sites monitored by AdRelevance jumped 39 percent. Although for most music sites, the spike was short-lived, a few, like Spinner.com and Sonic.Net, had sustained increases in advertising revenue through early September. But Napster itself does not stand to benefit from the effect, since its Web site does not carry advertisements.
